    • Method Detail

      • acquireValueFor

        default net.openhft.chronicle.core.values.LongValue acquireValueFor(CharSequence key)
        Acquire LongValue mapped to underlying file, providing atomic operations on the value that is shared across threads and/or JVMs. Note: The implementation of this method is not required to guarantee that if the value does not exist in the file, it will create one and only one value in the file in case of concurrent access. On the contrary, it's possible that different threads or processes acquire LongValues pointing to different fields in the underlying file. To prevent this, it is advised to use doWithExclusiveLock(Function) to wrap calls to this method, which will ensure exclusive access to file while initially acquiring values. Additionally, if this call is not guarded with doWithExclusiveLock(Function) it may potentially overwrite incomplete records done by other instances leading to data corruption.

        If the value isn't found, it is created with Long.MIN_VALUE value by default. To specify other default value, use acquireValueFor(CharSequence, long)

        Parameters:
        key - the key of the value
        Returns:
        LongValue object pointing to particular location in mapped underlying file

      • acquireValueFor

        net.openhft.chronicle.core.values.LongValue acquireValueFor(CharSequence key,
                                                            long defaultValue)

      • forEachKey

        <A> void forEachKey(A accumulator,
                    TableStoreIterator<A> tsIterator)

      • doWithExclusiveLock

        <R> R doWithExclusiveLock(Function<TableStore<T>,? extends R> code)
        Acquires file-system level lock on the underlying file, to prevent concurrent access from multiple processes. It is recommended to use this when acquiring your values for the first time, otherwise it is possible to get unpredictable results in case of multiple processes/threads trying to acquire values for the same key. In addition, it allows to batch multiple acquireValueFor(CharSequence) calls, to atomically acquire multiple values.
        Type Parameters:
        R - result type
        Parameters:
        code - code block to execute using locked table store
        Returns:
        result of code block execution

      • metadata

        T metadata()

      • readOnly

        default boolean readOnly()
